alert.note: Alert for Burke; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burke, Richmond and southwestern Aiken Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hephzibah, or 9 miles south of Fort Gordon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Augusta, Clearwater, Belvedere, Hephzibah, Jackson, Glendale, South Augusta, Midtown, McBean, Augusta Regional Airport, Burnettown, Blythe, New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park, Glenn Hills, Bath-Edie, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Westover, Richmond County Recreation Center and Phinizy Swamp Nature Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 5 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
